cards.name: Weedle
cards.text: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

attacks.name: Bug Hunch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Kakuna
cards.text: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Beedrill

abilities.name: Elusive Master
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is the last card in your hand, you may play it onto your Bench. If you do, draw 3 cards.

cards.text: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: Six of them form a single Pokémon. Should one of the six be lost, the next morning there will once more be six.

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: Each of its three heads has its own thoughts. When they want to go in different directions, Exeggutor becomes unable to move.

attacks.name: Head Crack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

cards.name: Yanma
cards.text: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Yanmega
cards.text: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: U-turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Pineco
cards.text: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Celebi
cards.text: This Pokémon has the ability to move through time. Records describing it as a forest deity can be found from many different eras.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Amazing Bloom
attacks.text: For each of your Benched Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Seedot
cards.text: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.

cards.name: Nuzleaf
cards.text: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

cards.name: Shiftry

abilities.name: Shifty Substitution
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, each Supporter card in your opponent's hand has the effect "Draw 3 cards." (This happens instead of the card's usual effect.)

cards.text: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe's mind and take preemptive action.

attacks.name: Fan Tornado
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Nincada
cards.text: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ninjask

abilities.name: Cast-off Shell
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for Shedinja and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Shaymin
cards.text: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flower Bearing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all attached cards and puts them on the bottom of their deck.

cards.name: Genesect
cards.text: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Techno Blast
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Skiddo
cards.text: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Gogoat
cards.text: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Dhelmise
cards.text: After a piece of seaweed merged with debris from a sunken ship, it was reborn as this ghost Pokémon.

attacks.name: Special Anchor
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Orbeetle V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Strafe
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mysterious Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Orbeetle VMAX

abilities.name: Eerie Beam
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Zarude V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Jungle Rising
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal all damage from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Raging Flames
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Charizard

abilities.name: Battle Sense
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other cards.

cards.text: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

attacks.name: Royal Blaze
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Leon card in your discard pile.

cards.name: Flareon

abilities.name: Incandescent Awakening
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Memory Capsule attached, Grass Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

cards.text: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon's body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.

cards.name: Slugma
cards.text: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Magcargo
cards.text: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Talonflame V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fast Flight
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Discard your hand and draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Bright Wing
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Vaporeon

abilities.name: Torrential Awakening
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Memory Capsule attached, Fire Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

cards.text: When Vaporeon's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

cards.name: Wailmer
cards.text: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Wailord

abilities.name: Water Veil
abilities.text: Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from it.

cards.text: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Oshawott
cards.text: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

cards.name: Dewott
cards.text: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

attacks.name: Aqua Wash
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

cards.name: Samurott

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

attacks.name: Aqua Wash
attacks.text: You may put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

cards.name: Galarian Darmanitan V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Freezing Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Frozen Slice
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Galarian Darmanitan VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Whiteout
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Chewtle
cards.text: Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to snap its jaws at anything in front of it.

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Drednaw
cards.text: With jaws that can shear through steel rods, this highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down on its unfortunate prey.

attacks.name: Vise Wave
attacks.text: If you played Nessa from your hand during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Cramorant
cards.text: Cramorant's gluttony led it to try to swallow an Arrokuda whole, which in turn led to Cramorant getting an Arrokuda stuck in its throat.

attacks.name: Continuous Gulp Missile
attacks.text: Discard any number of Arrokuda from your Bench. This attack does 60 damage for each Arrokuda you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Arrokuda
cards.text: If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon charges for it straightaway, leading with its sharply pointed jaw. It's very proud of that jaw.

attacks.name: Flock
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Arrokuda and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Barraskewda
cards.text: This Pokémon has a jaw that's as sharp as a spear and as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda's flesh is surprisingly tasty, too.

attacks.name: Targeted Skewer
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon for each damage counter on that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Pikachu V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pikachu VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Volt Tackle
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 150 more damage.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Poké Ball, it has zapped many people.

cards.name: Electrode

abilities.name: Buzzap Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to your Lightning Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck. If you searched your deck in this way, this Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.text: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.

cards.name: Jolteon

abilities.name: Thunderous Awakening
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Memory Capsule attached, Water Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

cards.text: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.

cards.name: Zapdos
cards.text: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Thunder Snipe
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon, and this attack does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon V or Pokémon-GX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Ampharos V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Damaging Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Raikou
cards.text: This rough Pokémon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.

attacks.name: Amazing Shot
attacks.text: This attack also does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Electrike
cards.text: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Manectric

abilities.name: High Speed
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.

cards.text: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.

cards.name: Blitzle
cards.text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

cards.name: Zebstrika
cards.text: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

cards.name: Joltik
cards.text: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It's soaking up static electricity because it can't produce a charge on its own.

cards.name: Galvantula
cards.text: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

attacks.name: Stun Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Shocking Pursuit
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Tynamo

abilities.name: Levitate
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: One alone can emit only trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

cards.name: Eelektrik
cards.text: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

attacks.name: Shocking Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Eelektross
cards.text: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

attacks.name: Electrified Bite Mark
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if they attach an Energy card from their hand to the Defending Pokémon, put 6 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electro Sprinkler
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon and 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zekrom
cards.text: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.

attacks.name: Wild Shock
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Zeraora
cards.text: It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its opponents with its high-voltage claws.

attacks.name: Fighting Lightning
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V or Pokémon-GX, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Pincurchin
cards.text: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

attacks.name: Spinning Fan
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.

attacks.name: Mini-Metronome
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Clefable

abilities.name: Lunar Blessing
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if your Active Pokémon has any Psychic Energy attached, you may heal 20 damage from it, and it recovers from a Special Condition.

cards.text: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.

cards.name: Girafarig
cards.text: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Commanding Tail
attacks.text: You may have your opponent shuffle their hand into their deck. If you do, your opponent draws 4 cards.

cards.name: Shedinja

abilities.name: Shell Survival
abilities.text: Put this Pokémon into play only with the effect of Ninjask's Cast-Off Shell Ability. (When you are setting up to play, you cannot put it face down as your Active Pokémon or on your Bench.)

cards.text: A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears in a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.

attacks.name: Life Squeeze
attacks.text: Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

cards.name: Shuppet
cards.text: There's a proverb that says, "Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk."

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Banette

abilities.name: Curse of Devolution
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may devolve 1 of your opponent's Benched evolved Pokémon by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

cards.text: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.

cards.name: Duskull
cards.text: If it finds bad children who won't listen to their parents, it will spirit them away—or so it's said.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.

cards.name: Dusclops
cards.text: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Dusknoir

abilities.name: Spectral Breach
abilities.text: All Special Energy attached to Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) provide Colorless Energy and have no other effect.

cards.text: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokémon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.

cards.name: Chimecho
cards.text: Emitting ultrasonic cries, it floats on winds to travel great distances.

attacks.name: Auspicious Tone
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon and a Supporter card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Woobat
cards.text: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it's evidence that Woobat live there.

attacks.name: Unamplified Soundwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If you have any cards in your hand, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Swoobat

abilities.name: Unaware
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to this Pokémon.

cards.text: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it won't be able to fly for a little while.

cards.name: Cottonee
cards.text: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

cards.name: Whimsicott
cards.text: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it'll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Flying Fury
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may discard any number of Pokémon Tools from your Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Dedenne
cards.text: Its upper whiskers are sensors that survey its surroundings. Its lower whiskers are organs that shoot electricity.

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Xerneas
cards.text: When the horns on its head shine in seven different colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

attacks.name: Geo Hunt
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Aurora Gain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Diancie

abilities.name: Sparkle Veil
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

attacks.name: Sensitive Ray
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Milcery
cards.text: This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. Its body is made of cream.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Alcremie

abilities.name: Sharing Sweets
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may have each player draw a card.

cards.text: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it's decorated with cream.

attacks.name: Wonder Shine
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Zacian
cards.text: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Armament
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Amazing Sword
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon VMAX in play, this attack does 150 more damage.

cards.name: Wooper
cards.text: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

cards.name: Quagsire
cards.text: It has an easygoing nature. It doesn't care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.

attacks.name: Fickle Impact
attacks.text: If you have exactly 2, 4, or 6 Prize cards remaining, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Shuckle
cards.text: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.

attacks.name: Deck Distiller
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Phanpy
cards.text: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.

attacks.name: Strike Back
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Donphan
cards.text: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Hitmontop
cards.text: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Tornado Kick
attacks.text: If you played Bea from your hand during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Regirock
cards.text: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Megaton Fall
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: It's exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

attacks.name: Best Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Drilbur
cards.text: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.

attacks.name: Focus Fist
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Terrakion
cards.text: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthen Power
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Zygarde
cards.text: Born when all of Zygarde's cells have been gathered together, it uses force to neutralize those who harm the ecosystem.

attacks.name: Core Avenger
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Rockruff
cards.text: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

cards.name: Lycanroc
cards.text: They live alone without forming packs. They will only listen to orders from Trainers who can draw out their true power.

cards.name: Mudbray
cards.text: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It's skilled at making use of mud.

cards.name: Mudsdale
cards.text: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale's legs sets harder than stone. It's so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.

attacks.name: Heavy Slam
attacks.text: This attack does 30 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Coalossal V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Coalossal VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Eruption Shot
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is an Energy card, this attack does 90 more damage, and attach that card to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Clobbopus
cards.text: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

cards.name: Grapploct
cards.text: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

attacks.name: Full Nelson
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Tentacle Buster
attacks.text: If this Pokémon used Full Nelson during your last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

cards.name: Zamazenta
cards.text: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.

attacks.name: Metal Armament
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Amazing Shield
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon VMAX.

cards.name: Poochyena
cards.text: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.

cards.name: Mightyena
cards.text: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.

attacks.name: Ferocious Bellow
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 50 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Sableye
cards.text: This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, it's believed that Sableye will steal people's spirits away.

attacks.name: Filch
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. During your opponent's next turn, that Pokémon can't use that attack.

cards.name: Drapion V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hazardous Claws
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

cards.name: Sandile
cards.text: Sandile's still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It's called "the cleaner of the desert."

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Krokorok
cards.text: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Krookodile
cards.text: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Tantrum
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.text: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

attacks.name: Lucky Find
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Garbodor
cards.text: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

attacks.name: Trash Cyclone
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Pokémon Tool card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Galarian Meowth
cards.text: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Galarian Perrserker
cards.text: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

attacks.name: Stealy Claws
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If any of them are heads, your opponent reveals their hand. Then, for each heads, discard a Trainer card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Forretress
cards.text: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Double KO
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are Knocked Out.

cards.name: Steelix V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Beldum
cards.text: If you anger it, it will do more than rampage. It will also burst out strong magnetism, causing nearby machines to break.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Metang
cards.text: It flies at high speeds around the skies. When it finds its prey, Metang takes a firm grip with its sharp claws and never lets go.

cards.name: Metagross

abilities.name: Levitation Field
abilities.text: Your Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: It analyzes its opponents with more accuracy than a supercomputer, which enables it to calmly back them into a corner.

attacks.name: Leg Quake
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Jirachi

abilities.name: Dreamy Revelation
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Put the other card back on top of your deck.

cards.text: Once every 1,000 years, the singing of a pure voice will rouse this Pokémon from its near-perpetual slumber. It wakes for only seven days.

attacks.name: Amazing Star
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 7 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Lucario
cards.text: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Knuckle Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Dialga
cards.text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

attacks.name: Rewind Time
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Metal Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash of Destruction
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Excadrill
cards.text: It's not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill's rampant digging.

attacks.name: Drill Run
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Ferroseed
cards.text: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn't very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

attacks.name: Reaction
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Ferrothorn
cards.text: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

attacks.name: Swift Swing
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Metal Energy attached to this Pokémon. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Galarian Stunfisk

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Aegislash V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sonic Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Aegislash VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Hack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card you have taken.

cards.name: Magearna
cards.text: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

attacks.name: Overhaul
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Windup Cannon
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Duraludon
cards.text: Its body resembles polished metal, and it's both lightweight and strong. The only drawback is that it rusts easily.

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

cards.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Gormandize
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

cards.text: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Lugia
cards.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

attacks.name: Wind Pressure
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or fewer cards in their hand, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Taillow
cards.text: It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to other lands in search of warmth, flying over 180 miles a day.

attacks.name: Double Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Swellow
cards.text: It dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. It catches its prey with sharp claws.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Whismur
cards.text: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Loudred
cards.text: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has the Round attack.

cards.name: Exploud
cards.text: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor—or like an earthquake has struck.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your Pokémon in play that has the Round attack.

cards.name: Rayquaza
cards.text: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.

attacks.name: Amazing Burst
attacks.text: Discard all basic Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each type of basic Energy you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Chatot
cards.text: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Minor Errand-Running
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Togekiss V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: White Wind
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an Evolution Pokémon, this attack does 70 more damage.

cards.name: Togekiss VMAX
cards.text: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Glide
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Tornadus
cards.text: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

attacks.name: Jet Draft
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pikipek
cards.text: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

cards.name: Trumbeak

abilities.name: Charging Trumpet
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

cards.name: Toucannon
cards.text: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

attacks.name: Energy Cutoff
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Loop Cannon
attacks.text: Put 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

cards.name: Allister
cards.text: Draw 3 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, discard up to 3 cards from your hand. (You must discard at least 1 card.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Bea
cards.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck, and attach any Energy cards you discarded in this way to your Benched Fighting Pokémon in any way you like.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Beauty
cards.text: If you go first, you may play this card during your first turn.,Draw 2 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Cara Liss
cards.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Rare Fossil cards and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Circhester Bath
cards.text: All Basic Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) take 20 less damage from attacks from the opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).,This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Drone Rotom
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If they do, look at the top card of your opponent's deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Hero's Medal
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,The Pokémon VMAX this card is attached to gets -100 HP, and if it is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, that player takes 1 fewer Prize card. You can't attach this card to a Pokémon VMAX that has 100 HP or less remaining.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: League Staff
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. If Wyndon Stadium is in play, draw 2 more cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Leon
cards.text: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Memory Capsule
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,The Pokémon this card is attached to can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.),You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Moomoo Cheese
cards.text: Heal 30 damage from up to 2 of your Pokémon that have Energy attached.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Nessa
cards.text: Put up to 4 in any combination of Water Pokémon and Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Opal
cards.text: Flip 2 coins. Search your deck for a number of cards up to the number of heads, put them into your hand, and shuffle your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Rocky Helmet
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if it is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Telescopic Sight
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.,The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Benched Pokémon V and Benched Pokémon-GX.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Wyndon Stadium
cards.text: Whenever either player plays a Pokémon VMAX from their hand to evolve a Pokémon V during their turn, heal 100 damage from that Pokémon.,This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Aromatic Grass Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Grass Energy.,The Grass Pokémon this card is attached to recovers from all Special Conditions and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

cards.name: Coating Metal Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Metal Energy.,The Metal Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

cards.name: Stone Fighting Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Fighting Energy.,The Fighting Pokémon this card is attached to takes 20 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Wash Water Energy
cards.text: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Water Energy.,Prevent all effects of attacks from your opponent's Pokémon done to the Water Pokémon this card is attached to. (Existing effects are not removed. Damage is not an effect.)

cards.name: Orbeetle V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal all damage from that Pokémon.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pikachu V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ampharos V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Damaging Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Alakazam V
cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Mind Ruler
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

cards.text: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Galarian Obstagoon

abilities.name: Untamed Shout
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

attacks.name: Obstruct
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

cards.name: Oranguru

abilities.name: Primate Wisdom
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch a card from your hand with the top card of your deck.

cards.text: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
